context.description: TCPIPServerInput node Use the TCPIPServerInput node to create a server connection to a raw TCPIP socket, and to receive data over that connection.

topic.label: TCPIPServerInput node
Deciding which nodes to use

context.description: Properties navigator This displays the node properties. Configure the node by selecting the properties and setting their values. Mandatory properties are marked with an asterisk.

topic.label: TCPIPServerInput node
TCPIPServerInput node - Configuring the TCPIPServerInput node

context.description: Description page If you want to describe the purpose of the node in the message flow, use these fields to enter a short description, a long description, or both

topic.label: TCPIPServerInput node
TCPIPServerInput node - Configuring the TCPIPServerInput node

context.description: Basic page Enter the host name, port number and timeout information for the TCPIPServerInput node.

topic.label: TCPIPServerInput node
TCPIPServerInput node - Configuring the TCPIPServerInput node

context.description: Advanced page Enter advanced configuration information for the TCPIPServerInput node: for example, whether the TCP/IP connection is closed after a record is received.

topic.label: TCPIPServerInput node
TCPIPServerInput node - Configuring the TCPIPServerInput node

context.description: Input Message Parsing page Set values for the properties that the node uses to determine how to parse the incoming message.

topic.label: TCPIPServerInput node
TCPIPServerInput node - Configuring the TCPIPServerInput node

context.description: Parsing Options page Edit the timing properties on this page to control when and how messages are parsed and validated. Select one of the XMLNSC options.

topic.label: TCPIPServerInput node
TCPIPServerInput node - Configuring the TCPIPServerInput node
Specifying opaque elements for the XMLNSC parser

context.description: Records and Elements page Specify how and to what extent you want your TCPIP records and elements to be processed.

topic.label: TCPIPServerInput node
TCPIPServerInput node - Configuring the TCPIPServerInput node

context.description: Retry page Choose how retry processing is to be performed when a flow fails.

topic.label: TCPIPServerInput node
TCPIPServerInput node - Configuring the TCPIPServerInput node

context.description: Validation page Set these properties if you want the MRM parser to validate the body of messages using the dictionary generated from the message set, and choose the failure action to be taken.

topic.label: TCPIPServerInput node
TCPIPServerInput node - Configuring the TCPIPServerInput node

context.description: Transactions page Set the transaction mode to say whether the message is to be received under syncpoint. The default is Yes.

topic.label: TCPIPServerInput node
TCPIPServerInput node - Configuring the TCPIPServerInput node

context.description: Instances page Select the pool from which additional instances are obtained; choose either the pool associated with the message flow or the pool associated with the node itself. In the latter case, set the number of additional instances to be given.

topic.label: TCPIPServerInput node
TCPIPServerInput node - Configuring the TCPIPServerInput node
Configurable message flow properties - Additional Instances
